translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The third section
The discussion of the non-percipient
Is there perception in the case of non-percipient beings?
Yes.

original: Saññābhavo saññāgati saññāsattāvāso saññāsaṁsāro saññāyoni saññattabhāvapaṭilābhoti?
analyzed: saññā bhavo saññā gati saññā sattā vāso saññā sasāro saññā yoni saññatta bhāva paṭilābho ti
translated: Is there a state of perception, a destination of perception, a rebirth of perception, a reappearance of perception, a manifestation of perception, a rebirth-linking of perception?
You may not say so.

original: Nanu asaññabhavo asaññagati asaññasattāvāso asaññasaṁsāro asaññayoni asaññattabhāvapaṭilābhoti?
analyzed: nanu asañña bhavaḥ asañña gati asañña sattā vāsaḥ asañña sa sāraḥ asañña yoni asaññatta bhāva paṭilābhaḥ ti
translated: But is there a non-percipient state, a non-percipient destination, a non-percipient rebirth, a non-percipient reappearance, a non-percipient manifestation, a non-percipient rebirth-linking?
Yes.

original: Hañci asaññabhavo asaññagati asaññasattāvāso asaññasaṁsāro asaññayoni asaññattabhāvapaṭilābho, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci asañña bhavaḥ asañña gati asañña sattā vāsaḥ asañña sa sāraḥ asañña yoni asaññatta bhāva paṭilābhaḥ no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: Well then, it is not tenable that you should say:
“There is perception in the case of non-percipient beings.”
Is there perception in the case of non-percipient beings?
Yes.

original: Pañcavokārabhavo gati sattāvāso saṁsāro yoni attabhāvapaṭilābhoti?
analyzed: pañcavokāra bhavaḥ sattā vāsaḥ sa sāraḥ yoni
translated: Is there a five-constituent state, a destination, a rebirth, a reappearance, a manifestation, a rebirth-linking?
You may not say so.

original: Nanu ekavokārabhavo gati sattāvāso saṁsāro yoni attabhāvapaṭilābhoti?
analyzed: nanu eka vokāra bhavaḥ sattā vāsaḥ sa sāraḥ yoni
translated: But is there a one-constituent state, a destination, a rebirth, a reappearance, a manifestation, a rebirth-linking?
Yes.

original: Hañci ekavokārabhavo gati sattāvāso saṁsāro yoni attabhāvapaṭilābho, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: ekavokāra bhavaḥ gati sattā vāso sa sāraḥ yoni atta bhāva paṭilābho no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: But surely you should not say:
‘In the existence of the non-percipient beings there is perception.’
“Is there perception in the existence of the non-percipient beings?
“Yes.

analyzed: tāya saññāya saññā karaṇīyam karoti iti
translated: “Does that perception perform the function of perception?
“You should not say so …

original: Manussesu saññā atthi, so ca saññābhavo saññāgati saññāsattāvāso saññāsaṁsāro saññāyoni saññattabhāvapaṭilābhoti?
analyzed: manussesu saññā atthi so ca saññā bhavaḥ saññā gati saññā sattā vāso saññā sasāro saññā yoni saññatta bhāva paṭilābho ti
translated: “Is there perception in human beings, and is that perceptual existence a destination, a realm of sentient beings, a rebirth, a station for sentient beings, a flux, a place of suffering, a place of misery, a place of terror, a place of doom, a place of (re)birth, a place of death, a place of (re)birth and death?
“Yes.

original: Asaññasattesu saññā atthi, so ca saññābhavo saññāgati sattāvāso saṁsāro yoni attabhāvapaṭilābhoti?
analyzed: asañña sattesu saññā atthi so ca saññā bhavo saññā gati sattā vāso sa sāraḥ yoni atta bhāva paṭilābho ti
translated: “Is there perception in the existence of the non-percipient beings, and is that perceptual existence a destination, a realm of sentient beings, a rebirth, a station for sentient beings, a flux, a place of suffering, a place of misery, a place of terror, a place of doom, a place of (re)birth, a place of death, a place of (re)birth and death?
“You should not say so …

original: Manussesu saññā atthi, so ca pañcavokārabhavo gati sattāvāso saṁsāro yoni attabhāvapaṭilābhoti?
analyzed: manussesu saññā atthi so ca pañcavokāra bhavaḥ gati sattā vāso sa sāraḥ yoni atta bhāva paṭilābho ti
translated: “Is there perception in human beings, and is that five-constituent existence a destination, a realm of sentient beings, a rebirth, a station for sentient beings, a flux, a place of suffering, a place of misery, a place of terror, a place of doom, a place of (re)birth, a place of death, a place of (re)birth and death?
“Yes.

original: Asaññasattesu saññā atthi, so ca pañcavokārabhavo gati sattāvāso saṁsāro yoni attabhāvapaṭilābhoti?
analyzed: asañña sattesu saññā atthi so ca pañcavokāra bhavaḥ gati sattā vāso sa sāraḥ yoni atta bhāva paṭilābho ti
translated: “Is there perception in the existence of the non-percipient beings, and is that five-constituent existence a destination, a realm of sentient beings, a rebirth, a station for sentient beings, a flux, a place of suffering, a place of misery, a place of terror, a place of doom, a place of (re)birth, a place of death, a place of (re)birth and death?
“You should not say so …

original: Manussesu saññā atthi, tāya saññāya saññākaraṇīyaṁ karotīti?
analyzed: manussesu saññā atthi tāya saññāya saññā karaṇīyam karoti iti
translated: “Among human beings there is perception, and he makes that perception the perception he will have?”
The Invitation Ceremony.

original: Asaññasattesu saññā atthi, tāya saññāya saññākaraṇīyaṁ karotīti?
analyzed: asañña sattesu saññā atthi tāya saññāya saññā karaṇīyam karoti iti
translated: “Among non-percipient beings there is perception, and he makes that perception the perception he will have?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …

original: Asaññasattesu saññā atthi, so ca asaññabhavo asaññagati asaññasattāvāso asaññasaṁsāro asaññayoni asaññattabhāvapaṭilābhoti?
analyzed: asañña sattesu saññā atthi so ca asañña bhavaḥ asañña gati asañña sattā vāsaḥ asañña sa sāraḥ asañña yoni asaññatta bhāva paṭilābho ti
translated: “Among non-percipient beings there is perception, and that non-percipient existence is a destination, a realm of rebirth, a station for consciousness, an abode of beings, a plane of existence, a birthplace of beings?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Manussesu saññā atthi, so ca asaññabhavo asaññagati …pe…
analyzed: āmantā  manussesu saññā atthi so ca a sañña bhavaḥ a sañña gati pe
translated: The invitation.🔽There is perception among human beings, and that non-percipient existence is a destination for non-percipient beings …🔽…

“Among human beings there is perception, and that non-percipient existence is a destination, a realm of rebirth, a station for consciousness, an abode of beings, a plane of existence, a birthplace of beings?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …

original: Asaññasattesu saññā atthi, so ca ekavokārabhavo gati sattāvāso saṁsāro yoni attabhāvapaṭilābhoti?
analyzed: asañña sattesu saññā atthi so ca eka vokāra bhavaḥ gati sattā vāso sa sāraḥ yoni atta bhāva paṭilābho ti
translated: “Among non-percipient beings there is perception, and that non-percipient existence is a single destination, a single realm of rebirth, a single station for consciousness, a single abode of beings, a single plane of existence, a single birthplace of beings?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Manussesu saññā atthi, so ca ekavokārabhavo gati …pe…
analyzed: āmantā  manussesu saññā atthi so ca ekavokāra bhavaḥ gati pe
translated: The Invitation.🔽Among humans there is perception, and that is a single realm of existence, a single destiny, a single station for rebirth, a single destination …

“Among human beings there is perception, and that non-percipient existence is a single destination, a single realm of rebirth, a single station for consciousness, a single abode of beings, a single plane of existence, a single birthplace of beings?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: Asaññasattesu saññā atthi, na ca tāya saññāya saññākaraṇīyaṁ karotīti?
analyzed: asañña sattesu saññā atthi na ca tāya saññāya saññā karaṇīyam karoti iti
translated: “Among non-percipient beings there is perception, and he does not make that perception the perception he will have?”
The Invitation Ceremony.

original: Manussesu saññā atthi, na ca tāya saññāya saññākaraṇīyaṁ karotīti?
analyzed: manussesu saññā atthi na ca tāya saññāya saññā karaṇīyam karoti iti
translated: Is there perception among human beings, but is there not something to be perceived by that perception?”
“No,” he said.
“It is not to be said:
‘There is perception among non-percipient beings.’
“Yes,” he replied.
“But, student, was it not said by the Blessed One:
‘Bhikkhus, there are deities called “non-percipient beings.”

original: saññuppādā ca pana te devā tamhā kāyā cavantī”ti.
analyzed: saññuppādā ca pana te devā tamhā kāyā cavanti iti
translated: With the arising of perception, those deities fall from that plane.’
“Is there such a suttanta?”
“Yes,” he replied.

analyzed: tena hi asañña sattesu saññā atthi iti
translated: “Then there is perception among non-percipient beings.”
“Is there perception among non-percipient beings?”

original: Kiñci kāle atthi, kiñci kāle natthīti.
analyzed: kiñci kāle atthi kiñci kāle na atthi iti
translated: “Sometimes there is, sometimes there isn’t.”

original: Kiñci kāle saññasattā kiñci kāle asaññasattā, kiñci kāle saññabhavo kiñci kāle asaññabhavo, kiñci kāle pañcavokārabhavo kiñci kāle ekavokārabhavoti?
analyzed: kiñci kāle sañña sattā kiñci kāle asañña sattā kiñci kāle sañña bhavo kiñci kāle asañña bhavo kiñci kāle pañcavokāra bhavo kiñci kāle ekavokāra bhavoti
translated: “Sometimes they are percipient beings, sometimes they are non-percipient beings; sometimes they have a five-sector existence, sometimes they have a one-sector existence?”
“No,” he replied.

original: Asaññasattesu saññā kiñci kāle atthi, kiñci kāle natthīti?
analyzed: asaññasattesu saññā kiñci kāle atthi kiñci kāle natthi iti
translated: “Is there sometimes perception among non-percipient beings, sometimes not?”
“Yes,” he replied.

original: Kaṁ kālaṁ atthi, kaṁ kālaṁ natthīti?
analyzed: kam kālam atthi kam kālam na atthi iti
translated: “At what time is there? At what time isn’t there?”

original: Cutikāle upapattikāle atthi, ṭhitikāle natthīti.🔽Cutikāle upapattikāle saññasattā, ṭhitikāle asaññasattā;
analyzed: cuti kāle upapatti kāle atthi ṭhiti kāle natthi iti  cuti kāle upapatti kāle sañña sattā ṭhiti kāle asañña sattā
translated: At the time of death and at the time of rebirth there is, but not at the time of abiding.🔽At the time of death and at the time of rebirth there are beings with perception, but not at the time of abiding;

analyzed: cuti kāle upapatti kāle sañña bhavo ṭhiti kāle asañña bhavo
translated: at the time of death and at the time of rebirth there is the state of having perception, but not at the time of abiding;

analyzed: cuti kāle upapatti kāle pañcavokāra bhavaḥ ṭhiti kāle ekavokāra bhavaḥ ti
translated: at the time of death and at the time of rebirth there is the five-constituent state, but not at the time of abiding?”
“No, friend.”
The Discussion of the Non-percipient is finished.
